articles.description: Infections with so-called brain-eating amoebas are very rare, but when they happen, the consequences are almost always lethal.
articles.content:
Naegleria fowleri, the amoeba responsible for the child's death, enters the body via the nose and travels to the brain where it begins destroying tissue. (Image credit: Shutterstock)

articles.title: Rise in cancer among younger people worries and puzzles doctors - STAT

articles.content:
When both the nurse and the doctor broke down in tears as they delivered the news, Chris Gosline knew that something difficult lay ahead.
